content:
sorry for the noise - just trying to understand threads
btw : is this different from slack ?
Its not clear if there is any difference here?

In zulip all comments are in a thread. also it is possible to move a comment to the correct thread.
In slack most comments start a new thread. and they can only be grouped before posting.
It is not a big theoretical difference, but it does feal different in practice.
Nice, I like this for organizing. It keeps everything much easier to navigate and discover
It also makes it possible to read over the stuff you've missed while away in a sane fashion
"Recent topics" is a much more usable firehose than many other chat apps i've used
